ca.uqac.lif.util

Class AnsiPrinter

  • java.lang.Object
    • java.io.OutputStream
      • java.io.FilterOutputStream
        • java.io.PrintStream
          • ca.uqac.lif.util.AnsiPrinter
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    java.io.Closeable, java.io.Flushable, java.lang.Appendable, java.lang.AutoCloseable

    public class AnsiPrinter
extends java.io.PrintStream

    Print stream with facilities for producing colored text using ANSI escape codes.

    • Nested Class Summary

      Nested Classes 
      Modifier and Type Class and Description
      static class  AnsiPrinter.Color
      Default 16-color scheme for foreground and background text

    • Field Detail

      • m_enabled

        protected boolean m_enabled

        Whether ANSI codes are enabled. If set to false (with disableColors()), behaves like a normal PrintStream

    • Constructor Detail

      • AnsiPrinter

        public AnsiPrinter(java.io.OutputStream out)

        Instantiates an AnsiPrinter.

        Parameters:
        out - The OutputStream where the printer will send its output

    • Method Detail

      • enableColors

        public void enableColors()

        Enables the output of ANSI codes in the output stream

      • disableColors

        public void disableColors()

        Disables the output of ANSI codes in the output stream

      • setForegroundColor

        public AnsiPrinter setForegroundColor(AnsiPrinter.Color c)

        Sets the foreground color for printed text. Until this color is changed, the text will be printed using that color.

        Parameters:
        c - The color
        Returns:
        This printer

      • fg

        public AnsiPrinter fg(AnsiPrinter.Color c)

        Shortcut to setForegroundColor(Color).

        Parameters:
        c - The colour
        Returns:
        This printer

      • setForegroundColor

        public AnsiPrinter setForegroundColor(int r,
                                      int g,
                                      int b)

        Sets the foreground color based on its RGB components.

        Parameters:
        r - The amount of red (R), between 0 and 255
        g - The amount of green (G), between 0 and 255
        b - The amount of blue (B), between 0 and 255
        Returns:
        This printer

      • setBackgroundColor

        public AnsiPrinter setBackgroundColor(AnsiPrinter.Color c)

        Parameters:

        Returns:
        This printer
